textAfterTable: 10 Songs Album Review Easy listening arranger Hugo Montenegro goes to Nashville and produces this not always successful hybrid, aided superbly by Billy Sherrill and a host of Nashville's top session men, including Harold Bradley and Charles McCoy. The album is best when Bradley's guitar or banjo takes the lead melody line, as it does on "Candy Kisses" and the charming "Crazy Arms." The same goes for McCoy's harp. But when they're given a backseat and the string section comes up front, a little bit of life goes out of the thing. Biography Born: 1925 in New York, NY Genre: Soundtrack Years Active: '50s, '60s, '70s, '80s Hugo Montenegro was a composer, arranger, and conductor who is primarily known for his movie work in the '60s, as well as his adaptations of film scores like The Good, the Bad and the Ugly.
